docs.abstract: New devices were introduced on Wednesday to get the digital assistant in your earbuds, in your eyeglasses and in your bathroom.
docs.snippet: New devices were introduced on Wednesday to get the digital assistant in your earbuds, in your eyeglasses and in your bathroom.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Alexa has already made herself at home in kitchens and living rooms. Now Amazon is trying to get her in your ears. And on your face. And in your bathroom.

headline.main: Amazon Wants Alexa to Move (With You) Far Beyond the Living Room
headline.print_headline: Amazon Aims To Put Alexa Everywhere That You Go

docs.abstract: Monday: Box-crowded sidewalks, traffic congestion and mushrooming warehouses are symptoms of New Yorkers' growing addiction to deliveries.
docs.snippet: Monday: Box-crowded sidewalks, traffic congestion and mushrooming warehouses are symptoms of New Yorkers' growing addiction to deliveries.

headline.main: How Your Amazon Delivery Helps to Clog the Streets

docs.abstract: With the ‘Yellow Vest‘ movement widening the country’s budget shortfall, the French government is accelerating a plan to hit companies like Apple, Facebook and Google with a big bill.
docs.snippet: With the ‘Yellow Vest‘ movement widening the country’s budget shortfall, the French government is accelerating a plan to hit companies like Apple, Facebook and Google with a big bill.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — With the so-called Yellow Vest movement forcing concessions that have widened the country’s budget shortfall, the French government is accelerating a plan to place hefty taxes on American technology giants that have long maneuvered to keep their bills low while reaping huge sums of money.

headline.main: France, Not Waiting for European Union, to Tax U.S. Tech Firms as ’19 Starts
headline.print_headline: France Eyes U.S. Tech Giants for Tax Gains

docs.abstract: Giant tech stocks have posted a remarkable year, shrugging off the trade war, bipartisan political hostility and regulatory threats.
docs.snippet: Giant tech stocks have posted a remarkable year, shrugging off the trade war, bipartisan political hostility and regulatory threats.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was December 2018, and the towering giants of tech were looking wobbly.

headline.main: Big Tech Is Under Attack, and Investors Couldn’t Care Less
headline.print_headline: Giant Stocks Shrug Off All Obstacles

docs.abstract: What all of the women with Amazon coats are doing this winter.
docs.snippet: What all of the women with Amazon coats are doing this winter.
docs.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, during another unseasonably warm fall day, my husband, in a pensive tone, posed a question: “Will it be embarrassing for you, to put your coat on again this year?”

headline.main: The Amazon Coat, One Year Later

docs.abstract: How two nonprofits took on Amazon and won, hand-clapping games from around the world and wedding websites that promise to stop romanticizing weddings at former slave plantations.
docs.snippet: How two nonprofits took on Amazon and won, hand-clapping games from around the world and wedding websites that promise to stop romanticizing weddings at former slave plantations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that Thanksgiving has whizzed by, the holiday shopping season is in full swing, which sometimes means stolen packages. Here’s a look at how many disappear on a regular basis and other stories you may missed from this past week.

docs.abstract: The shift from network schedules to TV-when-you-want-it may change not just viewing habits but the whole culture of the medium.
docs.snippet: The shift from network schedules to TV-when-you-want-it may change not just viewing habits but the whole culture of the medium.
docs.lead_paragraph: This may be TV’s biggest fall ever. It could also be its last.

headline.main: The Great Streaming Space-Time Warp Is Coming
headline.print_headline: The Great Streaming Space-Time Warp Is Coming

docs.abstract: Researchers in Japan and at the University of Michigan said they have found a way to take over the voice-controlled digital assistants.
docs.snippet: Researchers in Japan and at the University of Michigan said they have found a way to take over the voice-controlled digital assistants.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Since voice-controlled digital assistants were introduced a few years ago, security experts have fretted that systems like Apple’s Siri and Amazon’s Alexa were a privacy threat and could be easily hacked.

headline.main: With a Laser, Researchers Say They Can Hack Alexa, Google Home or Siri
headline.print_headline: Hacking Alexa With a Beam of Light

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)

docs.abstract: Bloomberg says Chinese spy chips were placed in equipment used by Apple and Amazon. The companies involved flatly deny it. Either way, the story raises important questions.
docs.snippet: Bloomberg says Chinese spy chips were placed in equipment used by Apple and Amazon. The companies involved flatly deny it. Either way, the story raises important questions.
